website_summaries.verdict: A larger incubator featuring a straightforward design and simple instructions that makes it extremely easy to enjoy hatching chickens, parrots, or whatever baby bird you’re looking forward to raising.
pros: Holds 9 chicken or duck eggs/16 quail or pigeon eggs
Customizable digital display and incubation timer to accommodate your species
Includes simple instruction guide and spare fuse
cons: A humidity meter would have been a helpful feature for keeping tabs on the health of your eggs

customer_reviews.title: Temperature malfunctioning- killing eggs
customer_reviews.text: This incubator thermostat keeps malfunctioning. I have kept the temperature set to 38 degrees Celsius, which is about 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit, and I’ll randomly notice about every day or two the thermostat placed on inside of the incubator saying 105 degrees Fahrenheit. I’ll also randomly notice the thermostat saying ~97 degrees Fahrenheit when the incubator is still set to 38 degrees Celsius. I didn’t have any issues with my first hatching cycle (21 days)- 100% of my eggs hatched and I didn’t notice the incubator acting up at all. The temperature fluctuations started with my second attempt to hatch eggs, and the incubator has already killed a third of the eggs I put in there.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Tenorio

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent temperatures
customer_reviews.text: In 2 hatches, I’ve gotten 30% hatch rate of fertilized eggs. Finally got a couple of thermometers in the incubator (I know, I know...should’ve done it earlier!!) and over a 24 hour period the temp has varied from 99.5 to 63.5. Not sure I’ll get anything out of this current hatch at all. If I could do it again, I’d spend twice the money and get one of the better known brands. I was really hopeful based on reviews, but... I’ll probably continue to try and struggle with it, but am disappointed with the incubator.
customer_reviews.author: yarn maven

customer_reviews.title: Incubator of Death
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible incubator. I’ve been hatching eggs for a decade. I know what I’m doing. After three attempts to use this, TWO in a classroom with very disappointed kids, it has produced nothing but dead embryos at early to mid stages of development. My humidity is good. I don’t know what is wrong with this machine. I switched back to my old huge Hoover Hatchery model and had a great hatch rate. I bought this for its size, digital display, and hilarious sales pitch. It’s too bad. Don’t waste your time, money and hopes on this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate temperature.
customer_reviews.text: The incubator’s temperature is inaccurate. I’m using 3 accurate hygrometers /thermometers and have run into several problems. First, because of the setup there isn’t a good way to measure right above the eggs. Second, if you place them front/back/bottom, each one reads differently, and they are +/- 9 degrees different than what the incubator is reporting. Regardless, I placed one on top of the egg tray and read it quickly after opening. The incubator definitely runs hot. I have to add 11 degrees to the front thermometer’s reading, and hope that is correct. Not user friendly at all
customer_reviews.author: Rockporters

customer_reviews.title: The lid pops off no matter how we set it up.
customer_reviews.text: Thus far the lid will not stay on and the turner doesnt work. The instructions stink to high heaven just like the eggs do after a couple weeks. This was a gift to my grandson for christmas so we are very disappointed. If anyone can tell me how to fix this issue i would certainly appreciate it, nothing we have tried works.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, does not regulate.
customer_reviews.text: The lack of a user manual can be looked past with the YouTube video, however the incubator was only able to regulate for 2 sets of eggs. It has not been able to maintain the needed temperature after. It was like the regulator broke. We thought it was our error, but after cooking about 40 eggs and trying every option to help it regulate we decided the unit is not reliable. I would spend the money on a more reliable incubator with an instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: luv my kiddos

customer_reviews.title: Decent starter unit
customer_reviews.text: This unit does ok but the humidity control is unbearable. The temperature control is perfect in controlled ambient environments. If you have it outside, it won't hold temps quite perfectly. Some low temps when it's cold and warm when it's hot. If it's inside it's perfect temps. The humidity control is very difficult. I suggest running it without eggs for a month, checking 2-3 times daily, so you can master humidity control before buying or collecting eggs. (If you have free eggs, then go for it!) It's a nice price for a small unit suitable for kids and such.
customer_reviews.author: fourdegreesc

customer_reviews.title: You Have to Babysit This Magicfly Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: You have to babysit this Magicfly Knockoff. After calibration, the temperature still fluctuates as much 0.5 to 1.5 degrees C. Think of any issue you've had with the Magicfly and multiply them by two. If you are incubating duck eggs, the automatic egg turner won't be able to rotate them 360 degrees. This isn't a fault of the incubator. I think it would rotate chicken eggs well. The eggs are rotated on their sides, but the distance they tray moves isn't long enough to completely rotate a duck egg because duck eggs have a larger circumference. I also recommend getting two quality digital thermometers that record the highest temperature so you can see if it's spiking.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for a small batch but monitor temperature
customer_reviews.text: The temperature indicator is in Celsius so it's a bit hard to control. On tenth of a change on the temperature makes a larger difference in degrees F*. I would monitor the temperature with another thermometer for best results. It ran hot. Otherwise no problems but it's not large enough for more than a 6 large eggs. We got 20 small bantem eggs inside but had to remove the automatic rotation. About half of our fertile eggs hatched. The written directions are dreadful but luckily some customers took the time to make videos for the product. Its not hard to use, but watch the video to operate the controls properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I’m incubating chicken eggs and I’m not satisfied with the discrepancies I keep running into with humidity and heat. We’re on day 7 today and 4 out of 6 eggs are fertile and growing, but I’m CONSTANTLY stressed the hell out because of the unreliable humidity and temperature readings. I’m so anxious about hatch day, especially because of these discrepancies.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Chong

customer_reviews.title: Great Incubator Even For A beginner
customer_reviews.text: Perfect beginner incubator, nice size to keep in a bedroom or out of the way in your living room. Has a low humming sound but I don’t find it annoying. Temp seems a little off and the fact that it doesn’t have a humidity thermometer is a bummer but not a game changer. I suggest buying a temp/humidity thermometer to place in the unit so you are sure to get an accurate reading and the ability to keep the humidity at the level you need. for hatching. The manual is not very clear however you do get a sheet mentioning 2 youtube videos you will find helpful! Overall a great incubator at a decent price!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cornette

customer_reviews.title: Hard to regulate
customer_reviews.text: Naw. I'll go with paying more for the hovabator. It's just so difficult to keep temps steady, you have to keep it wrapped in towels. It has no current temp/humidity display. I sent it back and got the 1588 hovabator. It's worth the money to get a great hatch rate.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieP

customer_reviews.title: Great incubator
customer_reviews.text: I have never incubated eggs before so I wasn't really sure how this would be. I work so I couldn't be around for all the turning you have to do and this worked perfectly. Before putting eggs in I had it on for a couple of house to check the temperature (I used an aquarium thermometer) and found that it was just a bit higher than the reading so I was able to adjust it. The instructions said you can put up to 9 chicken eggs in but, even though I had 3 rows, some of my eggs were too big to put that many in. I put 7 eggs in and all 7 hatched just fine..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 87.5% hatch rate! 7/8 fertile eggs hatched live
customer_reviews.text: Much better hatch rate than our first larger incubabtor! Temp was set at 37.4C i added about 1/4 cup of water and candled on day 7. On day 18 I added another 1/2 cup of water for lockdown. 1 hatched day 20, 5 hatched day 21 and 1 hatched day 22. Only one fertile egg did not hatch, seems to have died just before pipping. I'm not sure if it's the incubators fault. Great little incubator, we wrapped a towel around part of it to prevent heat loss.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Product was broken upon opening box. UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: I received the incubator in the mail today. I unboxed it and it has a huge crack in it. Not worth my time to send it back and wait for another. Update; the merchant did refund my money without even having to ask. Very professional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great success rate on hatching
customer_reviews.text: All my duck eggs hatched. I did have to use a humidity gauge and keeping the humidity right was a daily task but as description of incubator states, it only controls temperature, not humidity. The temperature setting on machine matched what my temperature/humidity gauge stated. I did have issues a couple times with the lid popping off but it may have been the auto-rotator bar was not in proper slot, I'm 100% not sure. However even with seeing the lid not on correct overnight, it didn't make a difference since all eggs hatched -- maybe summer in Texas helped that not make such a difference. I did reach out for customer service and was pleased with support.
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is a total rockstar!!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and get something better. The temperature fluctuations on the machine is horrible. Instructions are unreadable. The calibration is a joke. Edit. The customer service on this product is amazing. Still having major temp control problems. Trying to wrap with towels and rig it to get through this hatch. But the company selling this is obviously foreign because it is top notch. I unfortunately can’t find awesome sellers like this in America anymore. Great job guys!
customer_reviews.author: Gia Herring

customer_reviews.title: Decent incubator
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hatch my own chicken eggs for the first time. I ended up not using the automatic egg turner piece it came with and just hand turned them. I couldn’t fit as many eggs as i wanted with the automatic turner tray. Temperature control was great. Directions were terrible that it came with. It’s a pretty self explanatory product but still would have been nice to have directions that were easy to read and understand. I liked the size of this incubator too...I hatched 7 eggs but could have got probably up to 12 I’m there..that’s without using the automatic egg turner. With the turner I probably only would have been able to hatch 4.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Great little incubator. Almost foolproof.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. It was her first incubator. So easy to use. No issues. Later, upgraded her to a larger incubator, and this was easier and more reliable. If you don't want to hatch more then 9-12 eggs at a time, this really is ideal. Bought an auxiliary temp/humidity guage. Just keep an eye on your water/humidity. This things works great. So many adoreable little peepers. As long as you do your part with making sure there's water, this baby does it all for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, good quality. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: CONS: No humidity guage and unable to accurately control the humity. The directions were not easily understood. Simperler to go online for info. Just add a digital therometer and humidity guage, then calibrate. This is why i gave it 4 stars. PRO: Easy to use, compact and the least expensive for the quality you get. Worth the price. Good quality. Turns eggs automatically, small and compact. Great for first time users who are starting out. Or, if you only look to incubate no more then 6 full size eggs at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for the best... Till the end
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the incubator on 03/26/18. Arrived on the 28th, so great shipping (prime). However that's where the good news ends.... Began incubating on 03/31/18 and have fought with the temp and humidity since day one... Now on 04/14/18 just 4 days from lock down the FAN HAS STARTED GOING OUT!!! I'm unsure of what to do, I need these little guys to hatch and am worried with the complications they don't stand a chance.. UPDATE: seller contacted with refund and solutions so updated to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: WeOwnTheSea

customer_reviews.title: Heating element gets stuck ON
customer_reviews.text: After reading the broken English instructions over and over we have tried 2 batches in the incubator and all have failed because the heating element gets stuck on. We kept the incubator in a room at a constant 70 degrees Fahrenheit, set the incubator to the correct temperature via the controller , added 100ml of water as directed (and refill as directed), and everything will work great for a week or two until the heater gets stuck on and the temperature spikes to 41 Celcius and killing all chicks. Perhaps our unit is defective, but we are very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: ActionJosh

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome product! Super easy to set up and get ...
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome product! Super easy to set up and get my first ever round of incubating ready! Instructions were clear and easy to follow. I look forward to the final product. Seller was easy to communicate with and answered all my questions quickly before ordering as well. I would recommend this product for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Momof3boys

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a crack and instructions are not very clear. Updated: Seller was very professional and was happy to make things right. I will definitely recommend seller.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky soler

customer_reviews.title: egg turner not working
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a decent little incubator. It's our first. The directions are incredibly cryptic, even for english BUT there is a card that has links to youtube videos that break down how to use the machine. Everything seems to be as expected except for the egg turner. To my knowledge, it should be moving continuously but is not moving at all. This means we'll have to turn the eggs 4-6 times a day by hand or get a refund...I'm running the incubator over night to see if anything else goes wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Zeloszelos and Cadence

customer_reviews.title: Great product - 100% hatch
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of mixed reviews on this product but I have had 100% hatch rate with about 50 eggs. Some died after hatching for various reasons unrelated to incubation. This seems pretty cool proof and I haven’t had any trouble with the temp - seems accurate every time i check. Also, side note, i have been hand turning and not using the separator trays. I can fit about 20 eggs at time. None of the reviews said that many. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Priced right, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Venymae’s review was awesome. Thank you so much for the added info you shared. Her review is why I decided to purchase. We had one viable egg and we ended up with a chick and it was so awesome! My6 year old daughter and I were able to watch our chick break thru and hatch fully. We have 4 more viable eggs in there now and patiently waiting for results. If you are contemplating on purchasing, I say go for it and definitely read Venymae’s review.
customer_reviews.author: Angela W.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return
customer_reviews.text: This incubator is okay but I don’t think worth the money and wish I could return now. The directions are in aweful broken English that don’t make a lot of sense. There is no way to adjust humidity without removing the entire lid for a length of time. No way to measure humidity....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and the top was cracked in two places. A crack on each side of the top lid. It still worked. I put in 6 quail eggs. 3 hatched, 1 died in the egg and 2 weren't fertilized. I also used a small incubator were only one egg hatched. I would recommend this incubator over my small one. Wish this one had a count down on it though.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Best to avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: This incubator is reasonably priced and well put together. However, it fails at its most basic function: incubating eggs. The incubator sits at either 95 degrees or 101 degrees. It is either too hot or too cold, and no amount of tinkering with internal temperature settings changes this fact. The instruction manual is bare bones and does not explain most of the incubators features. You have to turn to youtube videos, amazon reviews and forum posts to help set it up. In 4 days I was able to close the gap from 95-101 to 97-101. Best to avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Friot

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed. This item is listed as an "egg incubator" ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. This item is listed as an "egg incubator" but has no humidity display or way to measure humidity. You are playing a guessing game with your eggs. This product is fine for dry incubating in some ideal weather situations, but otherwise this is NOT a good product for incubating eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Woodcement

customer_reviews.title: TEMP ISNT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this egg incubator for about a week now and YOU MUST buy a thermometer/humidity control to check how the eggs are doing. It says that they eggs are at 38.0oC, but it's actually under that! Also, the egg rotator can only fit about 6 eggs, I bought a dozen, so I have to turn them by hand a couple times a day. This egg incubator also makes a sound when you plug it in and emits a red light when it's dark.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest thing!
customer_reviews.text: I got this and put my little eggs in it that I took from our over worked new Momma hen. She had so many! I put some of them in the unit and in one day one hatched! Really exciting to hear the peep in the egg before it even hatched! Few days another! So yes it works. It does the job. We all loved it. Hard to wait for them.. Most all the eggs hatched. My first time at this.... A++++...
customer_reviews.author: Two Twiggs

customer_reviews.title: Decent little incubator
customer_reviews.text: Great little incubator! It fits 9 chicken eggs pretty well. It holds the temp consistent. I only rated 4 star b/c there is not a humidity control or meter to tell you what the humidity level is at. I had to purchase a separate gauge for humidity and it was very hard to find one that would fit into the incubator full of eggs! The directions are also about useless but there are several YouTube video that show how to set temp and such.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger S.

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for convenience look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this incubator because it had an automatic egg turner. I thought it would save me time because I wouldn't have to turn the eggs by hand. But the incubator's temperature fluctuates, constantly. I had to check and adjust the temperature multiple times, I'm talking 10 or more times a day. This is the 3rd time I have incubated eggs and this incubator turned a fun experience into an annoying experience. Please, if you are looking for convenience or just a good incubator look somewhere else. The only reason I gave this incubator a two is because it did hatch 3 eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Tusi

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and set the temperature and it seems to be running well. The eggs are developing as they should be. I do have a separate internal thermometer to monitor the humidity levels and the temp on it displays a couple degrees below what I set on the incubator, but I'm not concerned since they are developing. I love that your able to set the temp digitally. The one I used prior was a turn knob and the temperature fluctuated dramatically for a couple days killing the eggs. -I will update when the eggs hatch!-
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a little tweaking to keep temperature consistent.
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews about the temperature not being on target so I bought a small digital gauge to place in the body of the Incubator. I found a lot of heat was being lost in the bottom portion of the machine. I wrapped a towel around the outside and the temperature stabilized. Hatching ducks now in it and it works great. The temp on the digital guage shows 1 degree difference than what is set on the top so I just split the difference. I highly recommend it for the size and price.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Clarke

customer_reviews.title: hire an interpreter
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made.Looks great.Auto temperature is off by about 3-5 degrees.Instructions are almost incomprehensible,I wish that sellers from other countries would reinvest just a little of the money we spend on someone who speaks English to write the instructions.Nice for the price if you can figure these things out for yourself; UPDATE,, I changed my rating to a star.The company contacted me and took the time to address my concerns.They even asked for my opinion on how to improve the item I have had an opportunity to use it after talking to them..They are a very responsive company and want the best product possible.
customer_reviews.author: readitall

customer_reviews.title: It works well, is accurate, & able to be calibrated.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little difficult to interpret but the company included two video links that were tremendously helpful. I had a successful hatch with this unit the first time through! I tested the unit against a very accurate NIST thermometer and adjusted the calibration. It was spot on each time I checked it over the next 3 weeks. Do yourself a favor and buy a cheap hygrometer to stick in there too. It will save you some worry if you’re a newbie too :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product, simple in design and it's a good thing because the directions are certainly lacking. I am keeping an eye on the egg-turner because although it makes a sound, can't really perceive if it is moving or not. This is a great buy for someone interested in back yard chickens.
customer_reviews.author: JimBob

customer_reviews.title: Be absolutely certain to put a thermometer in and calibrate it.
customer_reviews.text: When mine was set to set to 38.2 C (100.8) it was actually 35.2 C (95.5 F). I had to go into the menu and correct (CA) by 4.3 degrees to get it to maintain to the correct temp. The first batch of eggs were not successful but I am going to try again. Also - I accidentally put the arm that moves the eggs back and forth thru an egg by accident my fault but be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek :)

customer_reviews.title: Would have had 5 stars if the temperature worked better
customer_reviews.text: It was impossible To keep the temperature correct. I had to use a secondary Hydrometer to make sure the temperature was correct and the humidity stayed up. I had to adjust the temperature every single day a couple times a day. But even though this was a pain the product did do its job I had a 100% hatch rate. It was just a pain to deal with the temperature everyday.. and it will only hold 6 chicken eggs.
customer_reviews.author: kassib

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, first time hatching eggs, 4 out of 6 hatched. The two that didn't not sure they were even fertile cause they got bacteria on them. I would definately recommend a separate thermometer for temp and humidity cause the incubator seemed to be like 10 degrees off. Other than that it worked well with the more accurate separate thermometer. The automatic egg turner was great to have that came with it. It was a neat experience to candle the eggs as they progressed and watch them hatch.
customer_reviews.author: linlu

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but needs humidity guage
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 6 hatched. The other two made it to the end but didn’t hatch and I’m certain it had to do with humidity. I would highly recommend getting an incubator with a humidity gauge or buying one to put in this so you know exactly what humidity you have.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were in English but broken, however it had helpful links on how to use. Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: We incubated both duck & chicken eggs 100% success. Bought because our broody mamma duck was lost to a raccoon :( so I jumped on amazon for an incubator snagged this with the 1 day shipping lucky me lucky duckies. Pretty straight forward. Not as scientific as I expected. Just had to add water every other day or so, we added a humidity dial thingy from our reptile collection to monitor humidity because I didn't really have the time to understand all that from the instructions. 2 healthy duckies & 3 healthy chickens. Yay
customer_reviews.author: Real Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent temperatures
customer_reviews.text: The incubator did not work as advertised. We took a clutch of fertilized eggs. Allowed one of our broody hens to hatch half, and tried the incubator for the other half. Our hen hatched all the eggs no problem. We followed all the instructions on the incubator and ended up with no hatched eggs. We believe the temperature was inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is our first time incubating. My six year old son has been begging to hatch his own chicks for almost 2 years so I agreed. So far so good! We had one hatch last night and two more in the process today. We started with 10 eggs. One was pulled because it made no progress. Out of the 9 left when we candled them last week we had movement in all. It's easy to use and a perfect size for someone who doesn't plan on hatching a ton at once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 9-12 eggs haha maybe if they were robin eggs
customer_reviews.text: It’s tiny, I have maybe 3 regular eggs in there and 5 tiny eggs and with anymore in there the auto turner wouldn’t move eggs at all. Temp is in celcius and don’t have a humidity controller built in. Was expecting so much more :-(
customer_reviews.author: Cristy Hood

customer_reviews.title: I keep my flock of laying chickens stocked with new chicks
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this incubator works and dirt cheap. I use it to keep a 6 egg rotation every 21 days . Hasn't failed me yet. Easy enough for a kid to operate. I just pull my chicks about 25 days or so put them on brooder wash out incubator add water eggs and away we go I get a better than 50% hatch rate but that has a lot to do with the eggs and my flock
customer_reviews.author: brendon

customer_reviews.title: Great Incubator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great incubator. However, I purchased two and they are both different. One says Magicfly and came with a Janoel manual. The second says Egg Incubator and came with the Janoel manual. Both work the same. Also, it doesn’t say in the manual but if you’d rather it be set to Fahrenheit just hold down the plus and minus buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Incubator
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this incubator and have successfully hatched 20 chicks in it over the last month. My only complaints would be the directions were difficult to understand and I've been unable to set the automatic turner, I still have to turn by hand. Also- be careful about where you put eggs under the pole for the automatic turner- I pierced an egg with it and needed to seal it- luckily the chick lived.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AND VERY EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A VERY GOOD PRODUCT MY HUSBANDS FIRST TIME USING IT AND 2 OUT OF THE 4 EGGS HATCHED BUT IT WORKED AND IT WAS JUST AN ERROR ON OUR SIDE FOR NOT CHECKING THE HUMIDITY LEVEL CORRECTLY OVERALL IT WORKED. WHAT I DIDNT LIKE AND I HOPE THE CAN FIX OR REVISE IS THE INSTRUCTIONS ITS NOT IN ORDER SO YOU HAVE TO GO BACK AND FOURTH FO LOOK FOR INFORMATION OR ATLEAST IF THEY COULD SORT THE INSTRUCTIONS BY TITLE OVERALL IT WORKS GOOD INCUBATOR AND IM SURE RECOMMENDING IT TO EVERYONE.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was our first time hatching eggs so I was a bit nervous about messing something up, but this incubator took the guess work out of it. We hatched out 12 chicks all happy and healthy. The only thing I would change about this incubator is the instructions, they need to be clearer, but I managed to find an awesome how go video that helped immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Described
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. Had no problems with temperature or humidity at all unlike some of the other reviews. Placed a few old eggs in it, which I'd collected from a few hens,to try it out & 1 hatched. The chick is perfectly normal & healthy. So cute! The others are still in there just in case. Followed the seller's instructions & looked up some videos online being as this was my first time doing this. Very pleased to see that it works. Just follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: scarletbutterfly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for hatching silkie chickens and hatched 6 of 6!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Will DEFINITELY hatch some chicks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hatch some quail chicks as pets. Out of 9 I got 5 eggs that hatched. Never incubated eggs before so I'm sure there are things I couldve done to improve my hatch rate. If you want to hatch just a couple of eggs then it's a good incubator. Never tried anything else but at least this one works.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Bad temp control
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it. Day 18 of incubation and when I checked on the machine it was reading 39.3°C and blinking H!!!! Not cool, I wish it would have an alarm or something! My eggs all got cooked!! Bummer, I did candle them and one of my chicks was still moving around in the egg so hopefully that lil guy will come out of the egg. If he does I'm gonna name him Shadrach because he would have survived a damn firey furnace!
customer_reviews.author: BeerkegGarage

customer_reviews.title: The fan stopped working...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this incubator a 5 star review, but couldn't do it. I've had three successful hatches out of this incubator. All from spring to summer last year. I just got it out of the cupboard last week to set a half dozen eggs for my daughters 5th grade classroom project, and while setting it up, the fan quit working and the motor started smoking in the classroom... Needless to say I had 28 very upset 5th graders. I did run out to TSC and bought a new incubator so we could still do the project... but I had to spend $150... grrrrr... No idea how to fix it, or if it even can be fixed...
customer_reviews.author: Candacer28

customer_reviews.title: Seller, please help me fix it
customer_reviews.text: I used it two times to hatch. It performed well. A little difficult to clean, the instructions are difficult to understand, but the unit comes ready to use off the shelf, so the instructions are only a big deal if you have trouble. When I went to use it for the third time, I plugged it in but the LED display didn’t light and no heat was produced. I’m hoping the seller writes back to tell me how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: PM Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: We have chicks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the last day of second hatching. For chickens, it holds 6 eggs. I got 5 on my first one and 4 so far on this one. It does work. The main thing that I strongly suggest is to buy a temp/humidity gauge to add in there. It does not have a humidity reading. The temp is a little off and there is an adjustment setting for that. Works great us! We recently lost 4 to coons so a few was all we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Wynn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 2 other incubators, which didn't work out, I purchased this one. I have 9 eggs in it, started incubating the other day, candled the eggs yesterday and it looks like at least 6 of the 9 eggs are going to give me chicks! This incubator turns the eggs automatically and I think that's the main key. I will update this review again when the hatching time is near. But for now - I really like this incubator and hope to hatch many many chicks out of it!
customer_reviews.author: abandelman

customer_reviews.title: Successful hatches from our backyard birds
customer_reviews.text: We raise chickens on our small farm and decided to cross our White Plymouth Rock cockerels with some of our hens this summer. The unit was easy to use, held about 8 eggs and did a good job - we docked it one star since it did require fitting a towel around the edges to keep the humidity high - not quite as "set it and forget it" as I might want. The hatch rate was 75%, all of which went to our neighbor. It's fun to see the birds we started from eggs now ranging on his pasture.
customer_reviews.author: $(this)

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful incubator for the price! Purchase a separate hygrometer and tape it to the far left wall and use YouTube for instr.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I waited to write a review until I experienced a hatch rate! The first hatch I only had 2 hatch out but they were very healthy and SHIPPED eggs. So I decided to go with local eggs and on day 21 we have 3 of 5 out and the other 2 have pips! For the cost of this incubator it’s fabulous! The instructions are useless but there are several videos on you tube and the internet to explain. Also I would purchase a separate hygrometer and tape it to the wall until hatch time so the chicks will be safe come hatch time. But for a auto turning incubator it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate temps. Huge temperature fluctuations
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up & set temp control, but hugely inaccurate temperature reading & poor temperature consistency. I have a thermometer & hydrometer inside the incubator & throughout the day the temperature fluctuates from 97-102° F I am not impressed. I will be returning it as soon as my better model arrives
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Aspen Ross

customer_reviews.title: Needs better instructions
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. The directions however, if you want to call them that, are not very clear. Especially for people that are just getting into hatching eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Becraft

customer_reviews.title: Just skip it.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is not consistent nor accurate. I incubated 9 eggs and only 4 hatched, two that hatched died later from birth defects caused by inconsistencies in temperature while incubating. IG live healthy chicks is your goal skip this week incubator.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Simple, compact and successful!
customer_reviews.text: I opened this incubator, turned it on, added a random amount of water and have successfully hatched chickens, quails and guinea fowl! I never measured the amount of water, I just always made sure there was a pool on the bottom and condensation on the sides. The only reason this incubator is not getting 5 stars is because I wish the top wasn’t frosted plastic. Clear plastic would allow a better view of the eggs. I love to check the eggs everyday and I don’t want to open the incubator too much. Overall- simple, intuitive and perfect for a small setup!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: 6 of 7 chicks hatched!
customer_reviews.text: I hatched 6 of 7 chicks. I checked the one that didn't hatch and I believe it was either to hot or humid for the little guy. he never pipped and looked as though it died on day 19 or 20 :( All 6 of the ones I hatched are happy and healthy! I do wish there was a humidity gauge on the incubator, Its a little hard to control the percentage also. I had to buy a thermometer and a humidity gauge because the temp meter on this is is a little off and fluctuates. I caught the temp almost below 99 at some points. Either way i'm still happy with my hatch rate using this incubator.
customer_reviews.author: taija

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful incubator!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this incubator! Its small and compact and does the job here is what we did. When we first received the incubator we took it out set it up and let it run for a couple of hours then we got a digital meat thermometer and calibrated it with ice water. Once it was calibrated we stuck it inside of the incubator and calibrated the incubator using that. We also used a towel to wrap around the sides to keep in the heat and clipped it to hold it in place. DO NOT COVER HOLE ON THE TOP or put the towel close to the plug in! Out of 21 fertile eggs we hatched 18 babies!!
customer_reviews.author: Caycie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not maintain temperature well at all!! It takes a lot of constant monitoring to make sure the temperature stays in the safe zone. If you’ve already purchased it you’ll need to get a secondary thermometer with a probe because the one it comes with isn’t accurate enough. Don’t waste your money there are better incubators at a similar price. Edit: I am 15 days in with this thing turned up as high as it will possibly go. It’s clocking in at a whopping 36.6 according to my 3 other thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Luke LeClair

customer_reviews.title: They need to get better instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Humidity is a pain to obtain. But with 100ml of water its impossible. How they get to 55o humidity. They need to explain that in the weird instructions. Also they need to get those instructions right. I'm fully bilingual and still can't make sense of the wording. We still giving it a shot..
customer_reviews.author: Pedro L. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.text: This is my second incubator. Both temperatures we're wrong so just buy a digital one with humidity. Fit 6 eggs. All were fertile and all 6 hatched on day 20. Very exciting!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: I incubated 6 eggs; 4 grew but only 3 hatched. It was very hard keeping the box warm, no insulation at all. I had to keep the room temp up in order to keep my box temp from dropping. I am somewhat satisfied but would like if the company tried to use a different material in the future to insulate the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hawker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but plus is terrible
customer_reviews.text: This item is just okay. My main issue is that the plug is really awful and loose. This causes the incubator to randomly turn off if it gets bumped even slightly. Luckily, this only happened twice during our 21 day incubation and we still managed to have 4/9 chicks hatch. It’s pretty easy to use. I set the temp at 38 degrees and then made sure to add 100ml water every 3 days or so. Once they hatched the chicks were fine in there for 24 hrs until we moved them to a brooder. The plug is REALLY awful though.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Arrigo

customer_reviews.title: Hatching was a success.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for hatching my ducklings. Only thing is there is no way to control the humidity but after few weeks of trial and error everything went great. Does not take up a lot of room and has auto turning which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: BC15

customer_reviews.title: Good starter
customer_reviews.text: Great basic incubator. Not much room but it works for small clutches. I’ve had above a 50% hatch rate for my backyard fertilized eggs - my hens can’t seem to keep it together to hatch their own at all so not too shabby. Great starter incubator for the newbie farmer.
customer_reviews.author: Noneya

customer_reviews.title: Works for the most part
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. Appears to maintain correct temperature well. Certainly need a hygrometer to observe and maintain correct humidity. I had nine eggs in the first run and one successfully hatched. Getting ready to start the second batch. Will see how this one turns out. I did candle my eggs every 3 days to check progress. Most didn't develop. One chick died a few days before hatching, cause unknown. Overall seems to be a good incubator.
customer_reviews.author: S. Willard

customer_reviews.title: Get it. The size is small but if that's all you need get this. Would be great for child project.
customer_reviews.text: It is working get. Had a small issue and the company when way above to take care of it. If you are thinking of getting and auto turning incubator this is it. I could only get 6 duck eggs, or chicken eggs, or 12 Guinea eggs.
customer_reviews.author: bryan persinger

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, saved some of our flock!
customer_reviews.text: Was so weary of purchasing this as we had a broody hen laying on 13 eggs! But we noticed she wasn’t as proactive to lay on the ones that had not hatched once they were being born. So we have hatched 7 chicks so far. It is amazing to watch it happen and big enough to allow the chicks to dry after hatching. I do not have a monitor in to see humidity and temp but we kept humidity at 78 as ours were days to hatching at end. Temp I kept at 38 degrees Celsius.
customer_reviews.author: Happymomof2

customer_reviews.title: Great incubator, difficult instructions
customer_reviews.text: Our first time hatching eggs. We put 4 eggs in & 4 eggs hatched! Once I figured it out, it was so easy. Which brings me to the only con, the instructions. Thankfully, they included a link to a YouTube video & that made all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: A Wheel

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Easy to use. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Got it and opened it and turned it right on. I just followed the temp settings on the manual. Kept water in the bottom. 8 out of 9 hatched our first use. I don’t think egg 9 was fertilized as no growth ever happened.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: impossible to regulate humidity and temperature
customer_reviews.text: i have had this incubator running for only a few days now and have found it impossible to get the temp and humidity right. i have hygrometer in there for a more accurate reading, like other reviews said: the thermometer is off by a few degrees, but the larger issue i’m having is with humidity. with a small amount of water in the bottom, the humidity is sitting at 92%. when i ran it without any water, it dropped to 25%. i am really hoping i didn’t spoil my eggs
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Sophia

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: This is an awful unit. The thermometer doesn't work. The temperature displayed is not what the actual temp is. So I went out and got a thermometer to put inside of it. I set it at 37.5c which is suppose to be 99.5f. The unit fluctuates from 97 to 102. Totally not acceptable and very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Blase

customer_reviews.title: Good starter.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a starter. We have successfully hatched four broods out of it. Remember to add water every other day and be careful putting the top back on. You can poke an egg if not careful with the auto turn probe.
customer_reviews.author: Emmett Tampa FL

customer_reviews.title: Great home incubator!
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue was the confusing instructions. I watched YouTube videos to verify how to set it up. I am on my first hatching and after candling the eggs, at least 7 of the 9 eggs are developing.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Newman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic incubator for our small homestead
customer_reviews.text: So glad we made this purchase! 5 hatched in our first batch (3 weren't fertilized and the last one we lost because we kept opening the lid to see what was going on) 7 in the second. Have a third batch hatching now. Extremely simple, almost no maintenance required, set it up and forget about it. Thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Lance&Anne RobinsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to work
customer_reviews.text: The first incubator that came in was cracked. The second one was fine. I would not recommend this to someone who new at incubating eggs. The smallest bit of water makes the humidity skyrocket. I bought a temp and humidity gauge to put in there and it took hours for me to get the right temp and humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This review is more about the customer service. The first incubator we received ended up shorting out as soon as we plugged it in, but HBLife immediately sent us a replacement once we notified them. The second arrived with a cracked lid and we were going to give up but HBLife asked for a picture and then sent yet another one. The good news is the third was fully functional. At this time, we have had our first hatch of quails and it was largely successful. Very effective incubator with some early hatches at 16 days.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas hyunho Cyin

customer_reviews.title: Good hatch rate for price
customer_reviews.text: Two hatches complete since purchase. I have consistently hatched 6 of 8 eggs. All eggs developed but not all hatch. Could be nature or it could be a temp issue. Will update with more info after more hatches.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep humidity at an even level - killed all my chicken eggs :(
customer_reviews.text: I had 13 chicken eggs for my first hatch. They were all alive and doing well up until lock-down. that's when the humidity level wouldn't stay over 60 no matter what I did :( All of my chickens died. Would return product if I could. I DO NOT recommend this product at all unless you want to be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Hatched 8 out of 9
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and instructions were clear. I loaded six eggs into the incubator and got it going. I had 3 Serama eggs and the rest were a mix. The Serama eggs hatched almost exactly on day 18 and the others except for one hatched on day 21. All the chicks are doing fine. Just have to remember to keep the bottom filled with water.
customer_reviews.author: Dopeshat

customer_reviews.title: Raised dozens of chicks at 75% hatch rate over 2 years. ITS GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible and a must have to raise chicks. Ive had 4 successful hatches back to back where 75% hatched and lived. Keep it in a back room or area where no light or draft gets to it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: So far this looks much better for controlling heat and moisture than the previous big ...
customer_reviews.text: We got the package very fast. Already started incubation 4 days in. So far this looks much better for controlling heat and moisture than the previous big box we had. Hope we have a successful hatch. Follow up to previous post: We have big chickens so we fit 6 eggs. All 6 chicks hatched, it kept them warm and cozy until they were fluffy and ready to come out. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Temperature issues
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is off , 37.5 Should maintain a 95.5 Fahrenheit, it does not. My machine is set for high and low at 38.2 . Sometimes the machine is at 100 degrees , or 93 degrees lately it is at 96.8 . I have 9 eggs in it now, not really sure if this is going to do a good job. I have ordered a different incubator for chicken eggs , it will not be here to help with my current eggs. This machine will be replaced by the new incubator, can’t count on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this product a 4 because I have only just started using it. Everything was there when it arrived. It was packaged well, no damage and came quickly. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: michael rambo

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to try hatching 2 of my cockatiels eggs after parents were breaking all eggs. This works perfect! Eggs developed great! Had to placed eggs with parents 3 days before hatching, they broke one egg, still waiting to see the second one hatch, not sure how parents will do.
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I set it up in maybe a minute, set it to 38c and left it for maybe an hour. I added my eggs, half a cup of water and a thermometer. I turned the eggs once a day, added half a cup of water every 3rd day and 21 days later I had chicks.
customer_reviews.author: jc richardson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Just turned this on. Incubator comes with motor to turn the eggs but motor doesn't work. No warranty help on this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect. Very simple
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect. Very simple. I haven't hatched any eggs, but I turned it on and put a refrigerated egg in (put a mark on it), just to see if it really turned the egg, and it did. It gets up to the right temperature quickly. I had used a homemade incubator in the past, but I can see this is going to be so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore

customer_reviews.title: ... as far as temperature and humidity goes but I'm disappointed that it will not hold 12 chicken eggs for ...
customer_reviews.text: The incubator works as far as temperature and humidity goes but I'm disappointed that it will not hold 12 chicken eggs for the automatic turning feature to work and it is not possible to see through the plastic for the hatching period. If I had understood this I would have purchased something else.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRI R.

product_meta.title: Egg Incubator, HBlife 9-12 Digital Fully Automatic Incubator for Chicken Eggs, Poultry Hatcher for Chickens Ducks Goose Birds
product_meta.description:
Specifications: 
Type: Digital Incubator 
Materials: PC+ABS 
Color: White 
Size: 13.98 x 7.48 x 6.89 inch (L x W x H) 
Voltage: 110-120V for USA,Canada (with USA plugs.) 
Frequency: 50-60Hz 
Egg Capacity: 9 Ordinary Chicken/Duck Eggs; 16 Pigeon/Quail Eggs 
Temperature: 38℃±1℃ 

Package including: 
1 x Egg Incubator 
1 x User manual 
1 x Power cord with US plug 

NOTE:
The Temperature For This Incubator It's In Celsius Not Fahrenheit Degree. Please Set The Temperature Up To 36 Celsius. When the ambient temperature is less than 25℃，it is better to take measures for heat preservation. It’s good for temperature uniformity when the device is enclosed with clothes or other warms, and it also helps energy-saving and reduces heat dissipation.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
